definitions.definition: The planned movement of troops, vehicles etc.; a strategic repositioning; (later also) a large training field-exercise of fighting units.

definitions.definition: Form created in the mind, rather than the forms perceived through the five senses; an instance of thinking.

definitions.definition: A way of thinking (associated with a group, nation or region).

definitions.definition: Pale, lacking colour, having a pallor
definitions.example: Are you feeling OK? You look a bit pasty.

definitions.definition: White-skinned
A West Highland White Terrier.
An inhabitant of the western suburbs of a city or town, stereotyped as of working class status and poor.
(Contemporary Christian) An intense fan of the Christian singer Matthew West.
definitions.example: The Westies in the crowd went wild when Matthew took the stage and sang Happy.

definitions.definition: A member of a criminal gang based in Hell's Kitchen on the west side of Manhattan.
The sale or other disposal of some kind of asset.
definitions.example: The fossil fuel divestment movement is calling on institutions to divest from the companies causing climate change.

definitions.definition: Mentally senile.
definitions.example: The elderly patients in the hospital were going gaga.

definitions.definition: Crazy.
definitions.example: You might go gaga if you stare at this screen too long.

definitions.definition: Infatuated.
definitions.example: The girls were going gaga over the handsome new boy who joined the class.

definitions.definition: A variant of dodgeball played inside a fenced area, usually a hexagon or octagon.
A certificate that certifies an amount of money owed to someone; a certificate of indebtedness.
A certificate of a loan made to the government; a government bond.

A type of debt instrument secured only by the general credit or promise to pay of the issuer, not involving any physical assets or collateral, now commonly issued by large, well established corporations with adequate credit ratings.
A document granting lenders a charge over a borrower’s physical assets, giving them a means to collect a debt, as part of a secured loan.
To furnish with cuffs.
To handcuff.
To hit, as a reproach, particularly with the open palm to the head; to slap.
To fight; to scuffle; to box.
To buffet.
Fitted with a cuff.
definitions.example: a cuffed catheter

definitions.definition: Confused, agitated noise as made by a crowd.
Violent commotion or agitation, often with confusion of sounds.
definitions.example: the tumult of the elements

definitions.definition: A riot or uprising.
To make a tumult; to be in great commotion.
A stool used for sitting, often taller than a chair and usually having a foot rest, commonly placed in bars and in front of kitchen counters.
A bacteriolytic (or antibiotic) enzyme found in many animal secretions, and in egg white
A drug or substance that counteracts the effects of a histamine. Commonly used to alleviate the symptoms of hay fever and other allergies.
An assistant rector or vicar.
A parish priest.
To act as a curator for.
definitions.example: She curated the traveling exhibition.

definitions.definition: To apply selectivity and taste to, as a collection of fashion items or web pages.
To work or act as a curator.
definitions.example: Not only does he curate for the museum, he manages the office and fund-raises.

definitions.definition: Any of a family of enzymes that catalyze the cleavage of phosphodiester links in nucleic acids.
(clothing) To put on, to dress in.
definitions.example: To don one's clothes.

definitions.definition: A female fox.
A malicious, quarrelsome or temperamental woman.
A racy or salacious woman.
A wife who has sex with other men with her husband's consent.
The part of the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus.
Any of the seven bones in this part of the foot.

A plate of dense connective tissue found in each eyelid, attached to either the superior tarsal muscle (in the upper eyelid) or inferior tarsal muscle (lower eyelid), which aid with sympathetic control.
In insects and other arthropods, any of a series of articulations in the true foot; the last joint forming the foot in spiders.
Of, relating to, or containing allegory
A door or partition consisting of a wooden frame covered in rice paper.
A flat stone used to pave a pathway, such as a walkway to one's home.
definitions.example: red brick pavers

definitions.definition: One who paves; one who lays pavement.
Fuck the world: an antisocial slogan.
Fuck the weight.
Forever two wheels: a biker slogan.
Tedium as a result of repetition or a lack of variety.
The property of a monotonic function.
The quality of having an unvarying tone or pitch.
A person who repairs (and originally made) watches.
Any of a class of aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a ring of five carbon atoms and an nitrogen atom; especially the simplest one, C5H5N.
Genetically different because of being derived from separate individuals of the same species.
Of a reaction that occurs when cells are transplanted into a genetically different recipient.
To imagine something as if it were to be true.
To present as in a vision.
To provide with a vision.
The act by which something is envisioned.
To make legal or permit under law. Either by decriminalising something that has been illegal or by specifically permitting it.
definitions.example: There is a debate whether or not to legalise some of the softer drugs.

definitions.definition: A steam-powered heavy road roller
Any heavy road roller
(by extension) any seemingly irresistible force
A pipe, used for smoking cannabis, open at both ends and having a bowl near one end; it rolls the smoke (steam)
To level a road using a steamroller
To proceed ruthlessly against all opposition as if with an overwhelming force; to overpower
The place where a spring breaks out of the ground; the source of water for a stream or well.
The source of something; a fountainhead.
The surface structure of an oil well etc.
That which overflows; the excess or side effect.
definitions.example: The spillover from the dam due to the heavy rains will run down this channel and harmlessly dump into that river, we hope.

definitions.definition: The spread of infectious disease between different species of animal and particularly to humans.
A tall, strong, athletic woman.
definitions.example: Although the evidence for real Amazons is thin, women athletes are often dubbed amazons.

definitions.definition: Written in minuscules, lowercase.
Written in minuscule handwriting style.
Very small, tiny.
definitions.example: a minuscule dot

definitions.definition: Continuing at full strength or intensity
Any member of Caninae, the only living subfamily of Canidae.
Any of certain extant canids regarded as similar to the dog or wolf (including coyotes, jackals, etc.) but distinguished from the vulpines, which are regarded as fox-like.
In heterodont mammals, the pointy tooth between the incisors and the premolars; a cuspid.
A king and a nine as a starting hand in Texas hold 'em due to phonetic similarity.
A stroboscopic lamp: a device used to produce regular flashes of light.
An electronic signal in hardware indicating that a value is ready to be read.
definitions.example: a memory strobe; a data strobe

definitions.definition: To flash like a stroboscopic lamp.
An act of reminiscence.
To recall the past in a private moment, often fondly or nostalgically.
To talk or write about memories of the past, especially pleasant memories.
To remember fondly; to reminisce about.
The previous life and experiences of a person, especially a character in a dramatic work, but also a real-life person.
A fictitious account of a person's history designed to conceal their actual history and motives.
A prequel.
A man or person skilled at hitting targets, as with a firearm, bow, or thrown object.
Goalscorer.
A process or result of rebuilding.
To build again.
To make widely known to the public.
definitions.example: The scandal was so publicised that he lost the next election.

definitions.definition: To advertise, create publicity for.
definitions.example: They're already publicising next month's concert.

definitions.definition: Of, or pertaining to, philosophy.
Rational; analytic or critically-minded; thoughtful.
Detached, calm, stoic.
